item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description:
"This wasn't just plain terrible, this was fancy terrible. This was terrible with raisins in it."
[<i>Women Know Everything!</i>]" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "<b>Résumé</b> Razors pain you, Rivers are damp, Acids stain you, And drugs cause cramp. Guns aren't lawful, Nooses give, Gas smells awful. You might as well live." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description:
"There's a hell of a distance between wise-cracking and wit. Wit has truth in it; wise-cracking is simply calisthenics with words."
[<i>Interview, The Paris Review</i>, Summer 1956]" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Love is like quicksilver in the hand. Leave the fingers open and it stays. Clutch it and it darts away." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Harvey Milk
item.description: "Hope will never be silent." -- Harvey Milk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Harvey Milk
item.description: "I know that you cannot live on hope alone, but without it, life is not worth living. And you...And you...And you...Gotta give em hope." -- Harvey Milk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are a uniquely portable magic." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Remember, Hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things, and no good thing ever dies." -- Stephen King
